To you , it is peculiar ; to gourmets , its delicious , and to Traverse City entrepreneur Marc Santucci , its a potential moneymaker for Michigan farmers .
The Mangalitsa pig , a Hungarian heritage breed raised for its fat , is very different from factory - farmed pigs , which are bred to produce lean meat and grow to harvest in just six months .

Because the animals are so much more profitable than other pigs , Santucci and some agriculture experts say Mangalitsas could be a new source of extra income for Michigan small farmers and help boost the states economy , while also enhancing Michigans growing reputation as a tourism destination for foodies .

Theres a reason most Americans have never heard of the woolly pigs .
Only 198 were left 20 years ago when a Spanish ham processor and a geneticist began a breeding program to save them .
Santucci discovered them while looking for unusual products for the Earthy Delights gourmet food business , in which hes an investor .

Santuccis plan is to develop a breeding herd to produce piglets for sale to small farmers , who would raise them for sale to chefs , charcuterie makers and other processors .
Earthy Delights will carry the pork , he said , and so will his main business , Cherry Capital Foods , which distributes locally produced products to restaurants in and around Traverse City .

A1: how Mangalitsas are butchered , prepared and processed for charcuterie
RelatedSentence: Polcyn , a nationally known charcuterie expert , will be an instructor at the four - day PigStock event next week in Traverse City , where two dozen top Midwestern chefs and other food experts will come to see how Mangalitsas are butchered , prepared and processed for charcuterie the European way .

The richly flavored , cured meats , sausages and terrines have never been more popular , and the specialized Mangalitsa pig will be around as long as real chefs find value in it ,  said Polcyn , whose restaurant is hosting a special multi-course Mangalitsa dinner Nov .

Santucci has his own plans for introducing more people to the Mangalitsas charms : Inspired by farm - based swine - roasts in villages all over Austria , he hopes to hold similar events for tourists at his Traverse City farm and cherry orchard next summer .
